meanings.definition: To make right; remove errors from.
meanings.sent1: She corrected her mistake on the test.
meanings.sent2: The teacher corrected the spelling errors in the essay.
meanings.sent3: He quickly corrected the wrong turn he made while driving.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic corrected the alignment of the car's wheels.
meanings.sent5: The chef corrected the seasoning in the soup to make it perfect.

meanings.sent1: The coach corrected the player for not following the rules.
meanings.sent2: The principal corrected the student's behavior with detention.
meanings.sent3: The parent corrected the child's behavior by taking away their toys.
meanings.sent4: The referee corrected the player's foul with a yellow card.
meanings.sent5: The sergeant corrected the soldier's mistake with extra training.

meanings.definition: To adjust or make changes to.
meanings.sent1: She corrected the brightness settings on the TV.
meanings.sent2: The editor corrected the formatting of the document.
meanings.sent3: He corrected the time on his watch after daylight saving time.
meanings.sent4: The tailor corrected the hem of the dress for a better fit.
meanings.sent5: The designer corrected the color scheme to match the client's preferences.
